subject: Communication
title: Verbal and Nonverbal Mismatch
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Verbal and Nonverbal Mismatch.

hook.text: Someone says 'I'm fine' while their jaw clenches and fists tighten. Your gut says they're not fine.

buildup.text: When words and body language contradict each other, it's called incongruence â€” and it raises red flags.

discovery.text: Deception researchers focus on these mismatches because the body often reveals what words try to hide.

twist.text: But incongruence doesn't always mean lying. It can signal inner conflict, nervousness, or social pressure.

climax.text: The most accurate deception detection combines verbal inconsistency, timing changes, and nonverbal mismatch.

punchline.text: When words say one thing and the body says another, listen to the body.

quiz.question: What is incongruence in body language?
options: Mismatch between verbal and nonverbal signals
